item.description: title:: “Time evolution of an infinite projected entangled pair state: Neighborhood tensor update” authors:: Jacek Dziarmaga publisher:: American Physical Society (APS) journal:: Physical Review B year:: 2021
title:: Efficient simulation of dynamics in two-dimensional quantum spin systems with isometric tensor networks authors:: Sheng-Hsuan Lin, Michael Zaletel, Frank Pollmann publisher:: journal:: 2112.
1 2 3 table authors, title from "Literature" sort authors asc

An isometric tensor network state (isoTNS) is a generalisation of the canonical form of a [[matrix product state]] (MPS) to higher dimensions, with the fundamental difference that these higher dimensional generalisations are approximate—while every MPS can be gauged into an isometric form, that is not the case in general for a [[project entangled pair state]] (PEPS).
In analogy to that of the [[matrix product state]] (MPS) representation of quantum states, operators can also be written as products of matrices.
cont. from written notes Repeat SVD until one open index per tensor. The wavefunction in this form is known as a *matrix product state.
A $n$-dimensional representation of a group $G$ on a vector space $\mathbb{V}$ denoted $\Gamma$ is a mapping from $G$ to the set $GL(\mathbb{V})$.
Abelian groups Suppose a hamiltonian $H$ is symmetric with respect to an abelian group $\mathcal{G}$ with group elements $g \in \mathcal{G}$.
Background and motivation This is effectively combining an [[isometric tensor network]] ansatz, with a locally purified one, motivated by the following:

Tensor products of matrices The Kronecker product of an $n_1 \times n_2$ matrix $A$ and a $m_1 \times m_2$ matrix $B$ is usually defined as the following $n_1 m_1 \times n_2 m_2$ matrix: $$ A \otimes B = \begin{pmatrix} a_{11}B & \cdots & a_{1 n_2} B \ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \ a_{n_1 1} B & \cdots & a_{n_1 n_2} B \end{pmatrix} $$

item.title: Isometric Tensor Network States in Two Dimensions
